channel.title: [317] Cache Issue - Are YOU Skilled Enough To Help?! [VERY DETAILED]
channel.description:
[CENTER][B][U]NOTICE:[/U][/B] I will [B][U]NOT[/U][/B] give you any money. I know this problem is a bit challenging to solve, but I have tried my best to put together the most detailed description of the issue below. If you need further details, please do not hesitate to let me know![/CENTER]
[center]I [u][b]AM[/b][/u] a [u][b]NEWBIE[/b][/u] at coding and creating RuneScape private servers in general. Please reply with the a detailed response please![/center]
[CENTER]Greetings, Rune-Server users![/CENTER]
[CENTER]I've had this issue for a couple days now. I managed to go from the black "Connection error whilst trying to load" screen, to the "Connection error - retrying in 5, 4, 3, 2, etc." to what you see in the image below at the end of this list that has been presented before you.
This IS definitely a cache issue. I JAR the client correctly, and still I receive this error. Perhaps my coding for where the server wants to download my cache from is incorrect?
This is a stupid problem to have, but it is a problem none the less![/CENTER]
[center]I'm using [I]StabbingScape[/I] client.[/center]
[center]------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------[/center]
[center]I do have a link for my cache. My cache folder is called "[I]evolved_cache_32[/I]" and I'm not even sure I posted the link to the cache in the correct area.
[B]Here's the link for my cache files:[/B]
[url=https://www.dropbox.com/s/g1krtn8fv058ivp/evolved_cache_32.zip]https://www.dropbox.com/s/g1krtn8fv058ivp/evolved_cache_32.zip[/url]
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Below is a list of my [I]gui.java[/I], [I]client.java[/I], and [I]server.java[/I] files all from my client source and server source folders.
[B]ALSO![/B] I added a file called "[I]Updater.java[/I]" to the list. Inside this file there was a location within the file codes where it needed my cache, so I placed the download from [I]Dropbox[/I] in there. I'm unsure if that was correct or not.[/COLOR]
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[B]Server source files:[/B]
• [I][B]Client.java[/B][/I] codes:
[url=http://privatepaste.com/d9e99ec514][U]privatepaste.com :: Paste ID d9e99ec514[/U][/url] [/center]
[CENTER]---------------[/CENTER]
[center]• [I][B]Server.java[/B][/I] codes:
[center][url=http://privatepaste.com/36b8bff2a1][U]privatepaste.com :: Paste ID 36b8bff2a1[/U][/url][/center]
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------[/center]
[center][B]Client source files:[/B]
[center]• [i][b]Signlink.java[/b][/i] codes:
[url=http://privatepaste.com/8cae85adca]http://privatepaste.com/8cae85adca[/url][/center]
---------------
• [I][B]Client.java[/B][/I] codes:
[url=http://privatepaste.com/88d16a031a][U]privatepaste.com :: Paste ID 88d16a031a[/U][/url][/center]
[CENTER]---------------[/CENTER]
[center]• [I][B]Gui.java[/B][/I] codes:
[url=http://privatepaste.com/a51c4fb821][U]privatepaste.com :: Paste ID a51c4fb821[/U][/url][/center]
[center][B]---------------[/B][/center]
[center]• [I][B]Updater.java[/B][/I] codes:
[url=http://privatepaste.com/2c2f2dd4ca][U]privatepaste.com :: Paste ID 2c2f2dd4ca[/U][/url][/center]
[center]------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------[/CENTER]
[CENTER][B]And here is the picture of what happens after I JAR the client that I am going to upload to a download link and distribute for other players to be able to play on my server:[/B][/CENTER]
[CENTER][URL=http://s328.photobucket.com/user/Brandon-FS/media/ISTHERENOONEWHOCANHELP.png.html][IMG]http://i328.photobucket.com/albums/l333/Brandon-FS/ISTHERENOONEWHOCANHELP.png[/img][/URL]
[B]I thank you in advance for helping, or attempting to help me, with my issue. It's very much appreciated! I wish there were some other way I could thank you more than just a few written words on a forum.
Plox Scape[/B][/CENTER]

item.title: [317] Cache Issue - Are YOU Skilled Enough To Help?! [VERY DETAILED]
item.dc:creator: @MrFun MrFun
item.description:
@MrFun wrote:

try this tut
http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-client/tutorials/212096-delta-making-webclient-delta.html
and remove the update.java, but the problem now is that the client doesn’t like downloading folders :S

Read full topic
item.source: [317] Cache Issue - Are YOU Skilled Enough To Help?! [VERY DETAILED]

item.title: [317] Cache Issue - Are YOU Skilled Enough To Help?! [VERY DETAILED]
item.dc:creator: @Damoiscool Damoiscool
item.description:
@Damoiscool wrote:

Your problem is client sided in the following bit of code (client.java)

method13(15, (byte)4, "Downloading Cache"); Updater.get("https://www.dropbox.com/s/g1krtn8fv058ivp/evolved_cache_32.zip", "evolved_cache_32.zip", "", "evolved_cache_32");

It is causing this compiler error.

See where it says required: String,String,String,String
Found: String,String,String

It means that it needs four strings separated each by a comma, yet you only have 3.
I have marked @damoiscool@ in red the location of the missing string.

method13(15, (byte)4, “Downloading Cache”);
Updater.get(“https://www.dropbox.com/s/g1krtn8fv058ivp/evolved_cache_32.zip”, “evolved_cache_32.zip”, “@damoiscool@”, “evolved_cache_32”);

I do not have this source so I cannot tell you what is supposed to be there, only that something is supposed to be there.
Hope this helps

Read full topic
item.source: [317] Cache Issue - Are YOU Skilled Enough To Help?! [VERY DETAILED]
